thread.title: Octavius Ellis scores 26 in Red-Black scrimmage
thread.title_full: Octavius Ellis scores 26 in Red-Black scrimmage

title: Octavius Ellis scores 26 in Red-Black scrimmage
text:
Octavius Ellis scores 26 in Red-Black scrimmage 
Updated: Sat, Oct 24 2015, 08:45 PM 
CINCINNATI (WKRC) -- Senior forward Octavius Ellis poured in a game-high 26 points on 11-of-16 shooting from the field in the University of Cincinnatiâ€™s Red and Black Scrimmage presented by Skyline Chili on Saturday at Fifth Third Arena. 
The Red and Black squads finished the 30-minute scrimmage tied at 51-51. The Red team was crowned the winner after edging the Black squad in a sudden-death free-throw shooting contest. 
Freshman swingman Jacob Evans added 10 points and five rebounds for the Red squad. Sophomore forward Gary Clark had a game-high 10 rebounds to go with three blocks and two points. Freshman guard Justin Jenifer contributed six points and a game-high five assists. 
Senior forward Shaq Thomas scored 11 of his team-high 15 points in the first half for the Black squad. He finished six of 15 from the field to go with three blocks. Senior guard Farad Cobb registered 13 points thanks in part to 3-of-5 shooting from beyond the arc. He also added six rebounds and three assists. Junior guard Troy Caupain poured in nine points and a team-best eight rebounds. 
The Bearcats play their first exhibition game on Nov. 3 against Grand Valley State. Tip time is 7 p.m. at Fifth Third Arena. 
Information provided by UC Athletics Related Stories
